modules.description: Provides functions to locate the PowerShell executable and convert file paths to DOS 8.3 format. Operates on file paths represented as Fpath.t and returns strings or error messages. Used to ensure compatibility with legacy systems and automate script execution in Windows environments.

Handles file path manipulation and system utility tasks, focusing on Windows compatibility. It works with Fpath.t values to locate PowerShell and generate DOS 8.3 filenames. Operations include path conversion and executable detection. For example, it can transform a modern path like "/user/docs/script.ps1" into "C:\DOCUME~1\SCRIPT.PS1" or verify PowerShell's presence for script invocation.

Copies and installs Opam binaries based on system architecture, placing 32-bit versions in the user's installation prefix on 32-bit systems and 64-bit versions on 64-bit systems. Operates on binary files and system-specific paths to ensure correct deployment. Used to prepare Opam tools for offline installation via the dkml-install-api.

Retrieves critical file system paths for an offline OPAM setup, including installation and configuration directories. Executes installation and uninstallation procedures based on a provided context. Registers the component with the system to ensure proper integration during offline builds.

Provides utilities for file path manipulation and system operations, with a focus on Windows compatibility. It works with Fpath.t values to handle path conversions, generate DOS 8.3 filenames, and detect executables like PowerShell. It can transform modern paths into legacy formats and verify the presence of system tools. Examples include converting "/user/docs/script.ps1" to "C:\DOCUME~1\SCRIPT.PS1" and checking if PowerShell is available.
